items.title: 'Patience is at an end': Minnesota judge orders ICE head to face court
items.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Live: Firefighters work to contain Victorian blazes as heatwave continues
items.description: Residents near a bushfire in southern Victoria face a nervous wait, while a heatwave that sent temperatures into the high 40s yesterday is set to impact parts of NSW and Queensland. Follow our live coverage.

items.title: Live: Aussie dollar surges past three-year high of 70 US cents as greenback tumbles
items.description: The Australian dollar has climbed to its highest level since February 2023 ahead of the latest ABS inflation data, which could further increase the odds of the Reserve Bank lifting interest rates at its policy meeting next week. Follow live.

items.title: Australia's largest city is running out of landfill. It's causing a trash war
items.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

items.title: Health minister promises change after woman overdoses from stockpiled meds
items.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

items.title: The honest feedback Alcaraz gave shattered de Minaur after Aus Open exit
items.description: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

items.title: Government turns defence sights north with $355m RAAF base upgrade
items.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

items.title: Live: Lib senator backs debate on Morrison's call for intervention in Islamic teaching
items.description: A contentious Scott Morrison proposal for an intervention in Islamic teaching is a "worthwhile discussion to have" in the wake of the Bondi terror attack. Follow live.

items.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
items.description: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

items.title: Rally organiser's claim of 'bashing' by Middle Eastern men comes unstuck
items.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

items.title: 'They're gonna die': How five people tried to stop the Challenger tragedy
items.description: Forty years ago, the Challenger space shuttle disintegrated just after lift-off. A small team of engineers tried to prevent the tragedy.

items.title: As Trump watches on, India and EU lock in 'mother of all deals'
items.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

items.title: Shooting involving Border Patrol near US–Mexico border leaves one critical
items.description: One person has been shot and is in critical condition after a shooting involving the Border Patrol near the US–Mexico border, authorities in Arizona say.

items.title: Historic heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: Rural residents trapped on rooftops awaiting rescue from North Queensland floodwater
items.description: A tropical low has dumped hundreds of millimetres of rain across North Queensland, prompting evacuations and cutting off communities, while the state's south-west braces for temperatures near 49C in a severe heatwave.

items.title: WWII and Bondi terrorist attack have similarities, daughter of victim says
items.description: Sabina Kleitman grew up knowing little about how her father survived the Holocaust as a child. Now she sees parallels between the horrors of World War II and his death at Bondi.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know this year's Hottest 100 countdown?
items.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

items.title: Ground caves-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide shortages
items.description: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

items.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
items.description: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

items.title: Violent threats to toddlers exposed in Busy Bees childcare complaints
items.description: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

items.title: Scallop fishers throw catch overboard as Queensland trawling ban extended
items.description: Fishing for scallops in inshore waters from Townsville to Hervey Bay was banned in 2021. While the catch will resume in the north, the southern fishery critical to the industry remains off limits.

items.title: Ratepayers to pay $60 million for WA performing arts centre budget blowout
items.description: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.

items.title: Three brothers among 35 killed as freezing conditions grip US
items.description: Much of the US was not forecast to get above freezing all day on Tuesday, local time, with temperatures plunging again overnight.

items.title: Fmr top cop says hunt for triple murder suspect a 'needle in a haystack' search
items.description: A former deputy commissioner of police who was involved in the eight-year search for one of Australia's most notorious fugitives says finding alleged Lake Cargelligo triple murderer Julian Ingram will be difficult.

items.title: One Nation is 'filling the void' for many Australians, they tell us why
items.description: Support for One Nation is rising and in former National Party heartland, people gathered for a music festival have told us why.
